website_summaries.verdict: With its analog looks and Bluetooth-syncing functions, the Withings Activite Pop is a clever, stylish blend of everyday watch and connected fitness band that lasts months on a single battery.
pros: The Activite Pop has great battery life, is water-resistant for showering or swimming, syncs with iOS and Android, tracks steps and sleep automatically, is affordable and is easy to use and wear
cons: Can't store data beyond a day and a half without syncing
analog watch face shows daily goal progress but no other stats

customer_reviews.title: Finally found the best fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: I have used 5 other types of trackers in the last two years (fitbit misfit garmin moov polar). Withings Activité Pop is by far the best. I finally found one that combines the things I love and eliminates the things I hate. I love the battery life and the fact that tracking is effortless. You don't have to put it in a special mode to record exercise or sleep. It connects to the app quickly every time. It is water resistant so shower, sweat, or swimming is no problem. It is simple, efficient and looks good. I'm glad I tried one more tracker before giving up on them.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Fancher

customer_reviews.title: The watch doesn't keep good time. I have had to re-sync the watch ...
customer_reviews.text: The watch doesn't keep good time. I have had to re-sync the watch every couple days or so to correct the time. Considering the main reason I got it is for the watch, it's a pretty big deal to me that the time isn't accurate. The app is also a major drain on my phone battery. I expected a bit of a difference, but it's basically cut my phone battery life in half. This would be something I could get past, but not the time keeping. You definitely get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Wish it worked as well as it looks
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this watch more. I love the way it looks and feels -- I have basically worn it 24/7 for 2 months. But it has two major flaws. First, you have to keep manually syncing it (particularly when traveling across time zones to update the time). But worst of all is that it doesn't keep time well: about once a week, the hands get out of calibration. This means your watch loses time -- often several minutes -- and the only way to fix is to recalibrate in the app. A watch that can't keep time isn't much of a watch at all. But when synced, the step tracking and especially the sleep tracking work well.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: I'm not happy with this product right now 😕
customer_reviews.text: Went swimming and there's condensation inside ... I sent an email to Withings and I have not heard from them. So, I'm not happy with this product right now 😕
customer_reviews.author: Josefina Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Best value for the style
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It looks gorgeous I get compliments on it all the time. Haven't had to replace battery for 6 months Tracks most activities Cons: Doesn't have period tracking (this is important to me) Gets some activities fully wrong. I can't/don't swim and I don't wear it in the shower either so sometimes I'm confused when it tells me good job for swimming. lol wut! The strap broke after like 7 months. I contacted their customer service and they're sending me a replacement strap free of charge, so that was nice,
customer_reviews.author: Hads N

customer_reviews.title: This watch is not READY for iphone users.
customer_reviews.text: This watch is not READY for iphone users. Heath Mate app on my iphone 6S plus with the latest IOS could not detected the watch. It was fixed by a workaround with an old android phone. The android phone can detect it but as another model - steel. Then I updated the software on the watch following the app instruction. I tried to link the watch to my iphone again by logging into the health mate app on my iPhone. It has correct the device shown up with my account. I didn't need to detect it. It now syncs with the iPhone ok.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Leung

customer_reviews.title: The round face is perfect. The Withings Activite Pop
customer_reviews.text: Withings Activite Pop-gray After owning 2 Garmin fitness trackers, I finally found one that is made for me. Pros: I have a very small wrist and the rectangular face shape on the others do not fit. The round face is perfect. The Withings Activite Pop, is waterproof as I am in water aerobics classes. It also automatically syncs with my phone, unlike the Garmin products that required several tries to manually sync.It has a long battery life. Best of all, it looks like a watch. The only other features I would like to see would be (date and measurement of stairs). It does exactly what it is built to do, smoothly and seamlessly. Overall, a great product.
customer_reviews.author: P. E. Malon

customer_reviews.title: Better than Fitbit or Apple Watch
customer_reviews.text: I have used a lot of trackers. This is the most precise and easiest to care for. I have measured this tracker against the Apple Watch, the FitBit, and a standard pedometer, as well as Nike Fuel. Since I can measure actual steps on a treadmill, it is easy to see which device gets closest - and this one is the best device of the bunch. You do not have to recharge this once a week or once a night - which means you don't have to bring extra gear with you when you travel. As a weight loss surgeon I am recommending this to my patients to track their steps daily - along with their scale.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Terry Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: fell into hot tub, water resistant watch, stopped working, after drying right away, insides were already rusty. Called Nokia as it was under warrenty & they refused to honor warrenty
customer_reviews.author: MarkT

customer_reviews.title: Great customer support!
customer_reviews.text: Works well and looks better than most trackers. Accuracy of steps decent but not perfect similar to others in this price range. After a while the minute hand would not move and their customer support was fantastic! After working out that the issue needed to be fixed by them they sent me a return label and promptly sent a replacement. Update: the new one has been working perfectly, and it seems they updated the ios app so the synching is much better. Overall very happy with the product and the support by Nokia.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine R.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a while.
customer_reviews.text: Good overall, though my wife wasn't impressed by the 'pregnancy mode' at all. The battery died after about a month. Then the strap broke after a few months. Within about 10 months, it no longer allows her to set the time of the device, the pedometer is way off, and the sleep monitor only logs zero to 1 hour of sleep during an 8 hour sleep session. I submitted a warranty claim. If I'm refunded or am given a functional replacement, I'll mention it here. But as the product stands itself, the features are good but worthless if it's just going to break with gentle use.
customer_reviews.author: JPL

customer_reviews.title: Weight Loss Help
customer_reviews.text: This fitness tracker is amazing and it's helped me lose nearly 30 lbs! I've not had any other fitness trackers before this one, so I can't really compare. I do love that it doesn't need charging, and you don't have to have your phone on you at all times in order to track your steps. I've been wearing it for about 6 months, and haven't had to change the battery yet. I highly recommend. Even if you're not aiming to lose weight, it helps you become more aware of your daily activity levels.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch, tracking just okay
customer_reviews.text: I love my watch but ever since Nokia bought the brand, well, the software has really gone downhill. I have to manually enter my swimming activity. Also, I don't understand why they can't credit changes in elevation like other trackers. Otherwise, it works great and looks great. I have bought several different colored bands that I change out according to my mood or outfit.
customer_reviews.author: Bixby Park

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy again, or buy up even
customer_reviews.text: This product is one of my favorites, after spending sometime with a Moto360. Much more compact, without a dying battery (although mine didn't hold for a year as promised, but for 9 months "only"), great fit and great looks. It has its issues, in syncing, and when the battery starts to die its not the great. Other minuses are the lack of elevation tracking, and that sleep tracking is mediocre. That being said, it's a great watch and step meter, and very worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Tsror

customer_reviews.title: Happy so far
customer_reviews.text: I like this watch a lot! Great price and great look. Only problems I have with watch is the tap on it to see alarm time.... how annoying when you are working and want to see the time and the hands are moving to alarm time. Only other issue I have with watch is the glass scratches easy in my opinion. I had the thought a sports type watch would be supper durable glass. Had to order a glass screen protector, kinda wish it came with one when you buy it. Happy so for with it though.
customer_reviews.author: JET

customer_reviews.title: Not good for swimming or sleep
customer_reviews.text: Well after trying the shine which failed, I really wanted the withings pop to work for me. I am disabled but do swim and wanted a swim tracker. This tracker failed me on two areas, swimming, it under tracks or not at all; sleeping, it starts tracking 2 to 3 hours after I fall asleep. I do have a Samsung gear that tracks sleep as well as many other functions but is not waterproof, that's ok, I will enter it manually into myfitnesspal and take my refund. Ps. Withings help desk was wonderful with trying to resolve these issue but really would have liked to talk to a person live after 8 emails.
customer_reviews.author: jrsygrl109

customer_reviews.title: very happy
customer_reviews.text: It's been a week and so far so good. It is beautiful, i get a lot of compliments for my watch, without the big sign "i'm tracking myself". I have really small wrist and was worried it would be to big, but it looks great. The app is not as good as the jawbone one, but i preferred this watch than the bracelet everyday. Besides i'll be using the app with myfittnesspal, and this way i'm tracking my calories too. The fact that you don't have to connect this to charge is a big bonus. I'm really happy with this tracker.
customer_reviews.author: María S

customer_reviews.title: The clock doesn't work. The fitness and sleep parts ...
customer_reviews.text: The clock doesn't work. The fitness and sleep parts are decent, but having a watch that's always an hour off, even after calibrating every day, is a huge inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sub-par watch, great app.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Watch is very stylish The app is very user friendly and produces great data. Cons: The watch face scratches very easily. Within two months I was looking for a replacement. I couldn't find the proper fit for the strap. One hole would be uncomfortably snug on my wrist and the next had the watch sliding around. Compared to other trackers I've used, this step counter underestimates. I've worn multiple trackers at the same time to compare and the Withings consistently averaged about 400 less steps a day for me. The battery needed replacement within a year. In summary, I ended up being very underwhelmed with the watch itself but really enjoyed using the Withings app.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. It looks like a watch and hides all my nerdyness!!! Nobody can tell I am tracking anything, and i get compliments: wow, so nice, so classy! I changed the bracelet to a leather strap, i really like it! Returned my hr for this one. No heartrate monitor on it though, but I make due :)
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Forget your fitbit!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS. I was burned on FitBit, and was looking for something that wasn't quite as crazy as an Apple Watch, but would tell me how I was doing on my fitness goals day to day. This is perfect! And i love that it looks like a normal watch. Most people don't even realize I'm tracking my activity with it! Occasionally it falls behind on time by like 2 minutes (this is after several weeks of use with no issues), but I just resynced (super easy) and it was back to the right time. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Great, works beautifully.
customer_reviews.text: I more or less haven't taken it off in the months since I got it. I wear it in the shower and swimming, and the waterproofing is obviously great. I replaced the battery myself when it wasn't connecting as rapidly to my phone as I was used to. (In retrospect I think that might have been an iPhone update issue, rather than the battery, though.)
customer_reviews.author: C. M. O'Hara

customer_reviews.title: The integration with My Fitness Pal does not work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The pros: Its water proof, you don't need to charge it weekly, it tracks sleep, you can quickly see your step count and the healthmate app is good enough as long as you don't need to integrate it with other products such as My Fitness Pal. The cons: The integration with My Fitness Pal does not work. Something seems to be backwards, the more you are active the less calories my fitness pal says that you have to eat. I would suggest to get a fitbit instead. Fitbit does reflect positive calorie adjustments the days that you are more active.
customer_reviews.author: Phantom1024

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and accurate device!
customer_reviews.text: I was using the WW Active Link, before they stopped supporting it. My point calculations have really lowered, but I'm betting it's a more accurate calculation than what I was doing before. It is a very attractive activity monitor; it looks just like a watch. I love that I can buy any watch replacement band (18mm), and having it function as a real watch is very nice. It tracks my sleep without me pushing any buttons, which is great, I would always forget to turn that feature on before. Love the percentage dial, gives me motivation to move the little dial!
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: I really like that the Withings Activite Pop looks like a regular
customer_reviews.text: I really like that the Withings Activite Pop looks like a regular watch with a nice clean face. That way I am not too distracted by the facts and figures of my activity. It works with a phone app, tracks your steps, sleep and can get your heart rate thru the camera. You do have to add a partnering app to track your food intake but that is easy too. Seeing my life in numbers has been eye opening. I am motivated to change my numbers.
customer_reviews.author: Denise K. White

customer_reviews.title: Discreet and stylish.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great watch. It is so discreet not looking like a activity watch and I bought the colorful bands to go with it. The app is somewhat easy to use. You can set walking goals daily if you want too. I wore it to bed once to track my sleep; but I sleep pretty well so I haven't worn it again. But it was interesting to see my sleep patterns for that night. I would recommend this watch if you want a simple and very stylish way to keep track of your activity. I really love it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Harshberger

customer_reviews.title: False advertising!
customer_reviews.text: The watch, for it's intended purpose, is very nice. But....it does not sync with Google Fit! Apparently before Nokia bought the company it did, but no longer. I wouldn't have purchased it if they hadn't have falsely advertised that it did. Nice watch, but no Google Fit support is a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Nice, solid watch/tracker
customer_reviews.text: Nice, solid watch/fitness tracker that was easy to use until they changed to Nokia. Now can't connect it to Walgreens or Fitness Pal which was the main reason I purchased it, able to connect it to so many different online fitness trackers. It does a good job of tracking walking, running and swimming and okay with swimming, another reason I bought it. Also, the day after I purchased it, it was on sale for 20% off but was not given the discount.
customer_reviews.author: K.C.57

customer_reviews.title: Watch Does not Maintain Accurate Time, Regular Recalibration of Hands Required
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Withings Activite Pop a little over a month ago. I selected this particular device because it was an activity tracker and presented an analog watch display (even though I know it's digital). I find that the activity tracker functionality works ok for what I need, but I'm particularly disappointed in the watch functionality. I find that the watch seems to loose about 5-10 minutes a week and, as such, I have to recalibrate the hands on a regular basis (at least once a week). I've had the watch for a little over 5 weeks so, unfortunately, I can't return it to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: WickeyStickit

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This watch unfortunately does not do what the manufacturer promises. They promise the watch will automatically recognize when you are running but that isn't true, or it's inconsistent at best. Their customer service is clearly coached to not provide any help on this issue. I got a form letter back that says it's a firmwear issue that will be fixed in the next app release. However, if you look online, people have been having the same problem for over a year and no update has been issued. I would not recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: malonemcbain

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Iin my opinion it is by far the best choice if you need an activity tracker and watch that is extremely low profile, most people does not even realize it is a smart watch. I like that. Battery life is really the 8 months they advertise. Batteries are inexpensive, although I was unable to change it on my own, I took the instructions I downloaded from the internet to a friendly watch repsir shop and they did it. Price is of course another pro. Very satisfied. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Eugenio Pantaleon

customer_reviews.title: (Bought first one at a retail store) It's a nice looking watch
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one... the first one lost time after a year. The minute hand was faulty, but I was beyond warranty and couldn't find the receipt. (Bought first one at a retail store) It's a nice looking watch. I bought for everyday wear as I couldn't stand taking my cell phone out all the time to see what time it was!
customer_reviews.author: WozinPA

customer_reviews.title: The light beige color is very nice but it does not stay beige
customer_reviews.text: I feel it does not track well activity that is not actual walking or running. The light beige color is very nice but it does not stay beige. It catches the color from the clothes and looks dirty after a little while. I've had it 6 months and it seems to need a new battery now. I like that I don't have to worry about getting it wet. I plan to swim with it but I doubt it will count the activity well. I'd like to buy a dark band for it as I am embarrassed to wear it the way it looks now. The stains won't come off!
customer_reviews.author: S. Graf

customer_reviews.title: Worked for few month
customer_reviews.text: Worked for few month, then condensation started to appear on the glass from inside and it stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Wahch

customer_reviews.title: Great Tracker - Truly Waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: This is the a fantastic activity and sleep tracker and I highly recommend it! Pros - It tracks accurately - both activity and sleep - It is 100% waterproof. This was a huge selling point for me and I have showered and swam with this on hundreds of times and it still works perfect - Looks great - Vibrating wake-up alarm is great - It does not track while moving in cars, buses, monorails, etc. Cons - It does track when I am riding on the riding mower - The face scratches easily
customer_reviews.author: cartwright02

customer_reviews.title: Magic watch.
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how much money my household has given to withings. We've got the scale, the blood pressure cuff, and now I have the watch. I love it. I love the look. It works as well as any other fitness tracker I've had, but looks like a watch so I don't feel like a goober. I'm dying to get to a pool to do some laps. I'm curious to see if it breaks after 6months-year like every tracker I've had in the past does. I will update if that is the case. It's a little big for my tiny lady arm but I like it that way.
customer_reviews.author: khillah

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful look and incredibly functional when paired with a screen ...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful look and incredibly functional when paired with a screen protector. The band was perhaps a bit flimsy, but no major complaints as some others have had. I badly wish Nokia would continue making this product! A shame to lose this mid-grade product to the Withings acquisition. Would buy ten times over thanks to its timekeeping abilities and loose (note: sometimes inaccurate and insensitive especially when doing nontraditional/non-cardio exercises - be careful to log a workout if it doesn't auto-recognize as it fails to do for weight training) activity tracking.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: i really like my watch so far
customer_reviews.text: i really like my watch so far. the band was not really big enough so i had to substitute with another one, but other wise it does a great job tracking my activity and sleep. folks have been impressed with the level of detail when i show them my charts. i do wish you could set more than one alarm, and it would have been nice to either have a light or at least have the arms and hours with some luminous ability to see it at night. that would have seemed like a no brainer but apparently not. Otherwise it looks good and works well during the week at the office and on the weekends around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen G. Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Step Counting Watch
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch. Love that I can count steps and still have a fashionable, function watch. The only drawback was being unable to get the back off to replace the battery. Customer service suggested I take it to a jeweler. I tried two different ones, and neither could get it off. So now it just sits in a drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Lareen

customer_reviews.title: Good watch
customer_reviews.text: I want to love it more. The watch does everything it says it does and is cute. My issue is that the clasp breaks my skin out even though I don't normally have sensitive skin. The watch face can be hard to read. I'm also regretting buying a watch to track my steps because I spend a lot of my "walking" time pushing wheelchairs, shopping carts, etc. and those don't get counted.
customer_reviews.author: Amy L.

customer_reviews.title: Sorta worked then stopped working altogether.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this watch for about one year. The watch frequently loses time, making it often 5-10 minutes behind. It is supposed to get the correct time from my phone when the app opens, but I have almost never had that work correctly. Only about 15% of the time does it actually pair to my phone when attempting to pair it. Finally, the watch just stopped pairing with my phone altogether, suck at 2 hours off, and not communicating the activity at all. I would expect a higher quality product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Zelectricity

customer_reviews.title: Stylish, comfortable, rugged, smart and practical!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this watch. I never take it off. I had bought 2 smart watches and they're sitting in the drawer collecting dust because they are too big and bulky, ugly, not tough and rugged for truly active people, and shouldn't even get wet. This one goes everywhere, does exactly what I want it to do, and goes with everything. I forget I'm even wearing it until someone compliments on it. App works great amd syncs activity automatically. I can even compete with.my friends. Way to go Withings! Just smart!
customer_reviews.author: pottamus

customer_reviews.title: Really happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: This watch is awesome. I wanted an activity tracker that wasn't as obvious, and was kind of classic looking, and this is perfect. That app is great, and the band is easily changed out. I've switched it out with some Barton bands just for looks - though the leather band I tried didn't fit between the bar and the face.
customer_reviews.author: Delayedscholar

customer_reviews.title: Pretty and pretty accurate
customer_reviews.text: my fibit Alta broke just after a year and even though they have an extraordinary app and product, i guess, it's hideous. I've been using my withings just three days now and I haven't taken it off. It's an attractive waterproof and sweatproof watch. So far my steps are accurate. But there is a lag in loading steps to the app. The app is clunky. It looks good but is all about extracting data whereas the Fitbit app just records it all. I don't mine the delay bc I can see my progress on my physical watch until it catches up.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Seminara

customer_reviews.title: Good for hands off tracker.  Don't use alarm features!
customer_reviews.text: Had fitbits in the past but would forget to charge them. This is easy because its almost 100% hands off. With a daily alarm on weekdays the battery lasted about 2.5 months which sucks. Lesson learned alarm disabled. The good think is that you can change it yourself with the circle tool (why pay $30). Just make sure you hear a snap/pop when you re-assemble. You really need to press down or it might not be water tight. The only other thing is the app needs to be relaunched every now and then. It would be nice if it had an idle alarm.
customer_reviews.author: Bugmage

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY!  Horrible Support and Worse Product
customer_reviews.text: The watch worked great until the battery required changing. As recommended, I took it into a jeweler to complete the task, although it is an easy process to do so yourself. Two Jewelers, numerous emails with Withings Tech Support and 4 months later, the watch is still not working and Withings Tech Support is simply repeating their previous suggestions which didn't work to begin with. I am moving on and getting a Fitbit. Any suggestions on how to get a refund for a lousy watch that doesn't work???????
customer_reviews.author: Chris G

customer_reviews.title: not so great...
customer_reviews.text: after wearing this for a month, I am not impressed. Pros: waterproof and no need to charge. Cons: app is horrible, syncing takes forever and does not happen automatically, steps seem fairly accurate but swim times (does not do distance or strokes) are way off. Also would have liked a second hand. Watch face is large but ok even on a petite wrist. Great idea that needs some work. In the mean time, I will pass this on to someone and get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Newengland

customer_reviews.title: This watch looks good, feels good and I like the tracker feature
customer_reviews.text: This watch looks good, feels good and I like the tracker feature. It did not however keep time. It would be off by 1 min or 2 mins and then 20 mins slow, then 40 mins. My experience with Withings customer service was robust....I probably communicated with 7 different reps... polite but not the most helpful. In the end I got a replacement and it seems to work fine. If I had gotten a working one out of the box I'd give it 4 stars. Hope you get a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith B.

customer_reviews.title: I'm so glad I bought this!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had this watch for a month and I love it. The sleep tracker feature isn't up to par as fitbits. Half of the time it's gets my sleep cycle wrong. But the step counting is accurate, it detects when I'm working out and gets whatever activity I'm doing correctly. Plus I don't have to charge it!!!!!🙌🏻 I would recommend this watch for anyone who just needs a stylist waterproof, activity watch.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Perryman

customer_reviews.title: Battery didn't last close to 8 months...
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty excited to try this watch. It's more stylish, in my opinion, than traditional fitness bands, and I was enticed by the promise of extended battery life (rather than nightly charging). Well, the battery died after only a few short months, so I've already been without the watch for a week while I get it replaced. I'd say the step and sleep tracking are adequate, so I'll probably continue to wear it once it's working again.
customer_reviews.author: D.M.

customer_reviews.title: Lovely alternative to fitbit
customer_reviews.text: Here's a step counter and sleep monitor that doesn't look like a fitbit. The band is still rubberized, but there are lots of colors to select from. This is also waterproof and supposedly counts swimming (haven't tested that yet, you need to swim for at least 5 minutes before it kicks in). The app and website that it works with are well designed and work well.
customer_reviews.author: dcgrrl

customer_reviews.title: Shipped battery is weak
customer_reviews.text: I love the watch. It's stylish and functional. It is accurate and the app for it is good. The app could be easier to use but it's acceptable. What bothers me the most is I have only had the watch 3 weeks and the battery is dead. I now have to get another one. They are less than $5 but I expected it to last the advertised 8 months or at least a little longer than 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Baggett

customer_reviews.title: I love that it doesn't look like an activity watch
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this watch for months now, and having owned a Fitbit and a Misfit in the past this one hands down takes the cake. I love that it doesn't look like an activity watch, but a normal watch. I still use my watch to tell time and this one works great. I love the activity indicator and how I can use my phone to see the details. I also love that I don't have to recharge it and instead it uses a watch battery. I would highly recommend for those who are looking for a more "fashionable" activity tracker that looks like a normal watch.
customer_reviews.author: Rockies Mom

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, poor company customer service
customer_reviews.text: This was the second watch we purchased after returning the first because it was a lemon (would not set up from the get go). This one worked for a couple of weeks, then required constant time re-calibration, finally last week it simply stopped responding, even with a brand new battery. This company's customer service has not been very responsive, I would definitely not recommend this product or company.
customer_reviews.author: Sidharth Phadke

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: I want to like this watch. I do. I read the reviews about the hands resetting and that does not bother me. However, the face of the watch has completely cracked from side to side. I am not a rugged person. I basically live in the office. My regular watch has lasted me years without issue. This one lasted one month! That's it. I love that I don't have to charge it every night to track activity. The battery is supposed to last six months. But if it only lasts a month does it really matter?
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Huber

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.  Slow upload and set functions, battery hog, idiotic alarm features
customer_reviews.text: I received this las year as a Christmas gift and have been consistently disappointed with it. First of f, the functions to upload are excruciatingly slow and require that the watch be nearly next to the phone device to work. I was very interested in the noiseless alarm function, but the interface only a single alarm time to be set. As I wake up at different times on different days, I then need to deal with the 5 minute function of setting the alarm every other day as my schedule changes. Thirdly, the thing is a battery hog. Already this year it has gone through 4 batteries, requiring me to go to a jeweler to replace. Overall vey disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Johnnygerman6

customer_reviews.title: Big hit
customer_reviews.text: Love this! bought it for hubs for fun and to get him to wear a watch, wasn't sure it would be a hit, but it really is. Much cooler than those fitness tracker bracelets with the digital display, this syncs up with the app really easily to look at your activity, and sleep! So great that it doesn't need to be charged, that would be a deal breaker. Love it, nice size too, not a big flashy watch. Also ordered the Steel HR for myself from the Co direct, also highly recommend that!
customer_reviews.author: jaime

customer_reviews.title: This watch looks good but does not keep going
customer_reviews.text: This watch looks good but does not keep going. It has frozen and had to be replaced and the new one that I got had to have the battery replaced once a month since January. It no longer tracks sleep or connects to my phone. Customer service has been a nightmare with no less than 10 emails asking them to replace this defictive watch. They keep having more hoops for me to jump through. I am just going to buy another watch and cut my losses.
customer_reviews.author: kk

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working completely after a month. Software was horrible and syncing was almost impossible when it did work. Horrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Stratton

customer_reviews.title: Good watch, tells time
customer_reviews.text: Good watch, tells time, step counting is good, but think it adds steps for driving and moving your arms around, app is nice. Does not sync with myfitnesspal as well as I was hoping but they do work together, but you'll end up using the health mate app for calorie tracking and myfitnesspal for logging meals. Not a fancy watch but nice enough for business casual and for working out. Don't expect to be able to wake up to the vibration alarm, it's too weak to wake anyone up from a deep sleep. Probably best for a subtle reminder while awake. Band is comfortable. Yeah, all in all a nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Chooch

customer_reviews.title: even at work and it looks like a classy watch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my sister as a birthday present. She loves it that she can wear it everyday, even at work and it looks like a classy watch. The activity tracker is awesome because it can tell her how much of her goal she has reached. Thus it makes her get up from her desk and take a walk. Watch works great and it does not need to be charged every few days.
customer_reviews.author: tr

customer_reviews.title: Newer product, working out some bugs.
customer_reviews.text: Update 1-6-16: Sending it back to Withings for a 2nd replacement since September. Customer service is great, not real happy having paid the full price $149.95 and having to send it back twice already. I moved from a Misfit Shine to the Withings Pop and like it so much better. I had missed having an actual watch and I really like the dial that shows progress towards my goal. The only negative thing I can say, is it's a little big, I have a very small wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: while I liked that, I loved the watch-fitness tracker combo
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after admiring my friend's Pop. I had an UP2 at the time and, while I liked that, I loved the watch-fitness tracker combo. I wear this every day. While it's my preferred tracker, I have noticed that it's not as good as the UP2 at tracking steps when I'm carrying something or pushing a grocery cart. Its app leaves a bit to be desired, but the sleek look and convenience of a tracker-watch combo make this my go-to tracker.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn H

customer_reviews.title: Fits good, gets a lot of compliments
customer_reviews.text: Fits good, gets a lot of compliments. The product does not track time accurately with more or less 15 minutes ahead per day that goes by.... battery ran out 1 day after activating it... as much as I was really excited about the product, by all means, do not buy it, positively sure, do not buy it.... spend your money on a fitbit or a pebble
customer_reviews.author: Jose Esteban

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: This watch is meant to track steps and look pretty and nothing more. It looks fashionable enough, but it does horendously at tracking steps. It gets maybe 25%-50% of the steps of a fitbit worn on the same arm. When doing simple counted walks, the fitbit appears to be far more accurate. you'd be better off just getting a cheap watch and forgetting the step counting if you want this.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: i think its defective or something -very disappointed! I have withings weight scale and it is ...
customer_reviews.text: pedometer is off by 50% or more compere to other tracking devices , sleep tracking is a joke - not even close to real numbers. i think its defective or something -very disappointed! I have withings weight scale and it is superior product, thats why i decided to buy their tracker. well , it didnt work out , returning it now. will try newer version when it will come out
customer_reviews.author: kerktam

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life is Absolutely Terrible
customer_reviews.text: This watch is great looking, and its partner app is elegant and user-friendly; however, the battery life of this watch is minimal, which is a deal breaker for me considering you must take it to a jeweler in order to have the battery replaced. I have had my Withing watch for about one month, and I have already been notified that the battery will die soon. Beware the 8 month battery life claim-- according to a rep from the company, 8 months is with "the most conservative usage scenario" in mind. If you plan to use this watch with all its perks, you're going to be earning most of your steps running back and forth to the jeweler.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: ... you're looking for an activity tracker that doesn't look like one this is a great product
customer_reviews.text: If you've got other Withings products and you're looking for an activity tracker that doesn't look like one this is a great product. My favorite feature is the silent alarm, which works great and since it's just a vibrate on your wrist doesn't wake anyone else up.
customer_reviews.author: Doyle Lewis

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT. I get compliments on it as a ...
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT. I get compliments on it as a watch, and then people get super excited when they find out its also a fitness tracker. Its made me actually track my fitness because I don't have to take it off for less casual occasions. The app isn't the most intuitive and you can't add activities (such as biking or elliptical time) that the watch doesn't innately track. But those are all software issues that can be fixed with time. The hardware is beautiful, well built, and stylish. I'm an average sized female (5' 5", 135 lbs) and it looks normal sized on my wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: The crystal isn't tuff enough for everyday wear, buyer beware! And the don't offer repairs.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time to review on Amazon. I tend to let a lot of things go, but I can't let this go. My wife and I bought two of these watches new and not much later, she cracked the crystal. I then dropped it and it shattered completely. Upon asking for a repair, I was offered a 25% discount towards a new watch. No thanks. My next purchase is going to be the Timex Metro, hopefully they will stand behind there product, unlike the Withings company. I bought my watch in October of 2015 so I am well within the 2 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick M.

customer_reviews.title: What his really good. It doesn’t check heart rate and for For ...
customer_reviews.text: Watch is really good. Though it doesn’t check heart rate and for heart rate you can use its health mate app which is capable of check heart rate using phones camera which is kinda cool. Very light weight. Watch itself is very great Just didn’t like the UI of health mate app, it needs to be redrawn.
customer_reviews.author: Pooja

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected....
customer_reviews.text: A lot better than I expected. I've had a fit bit and this seems to keep track of sleep and activity just as well or better - love the fact that its waterproof. Initially hard to synch up on bluetooth with iPhone6 but it worked after several tries nd now works like a charm. I also like that it looks nice as a watch.
customer_reviews.author: Amir NC

customer_reviews.title: Not for me :/
customer_reviews.text: Not work as I've expected...if you walk a lot pushing a shopping car and not move your arms, not rae NOTHING, DOES NOT MATTER THE EFFORT YOU DID...or if you paint a room for hours, and use your right arm, the same problem. The stylish, is good, I've bought all the colors for the bands, and looks good, but not work on all excercises, ie, ypga, pilates, etc, etc, you will need to shake your arm to score your rate day...
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth R. Saavedra

customer_reviews.title: Great look and feel but short on quality
customer_reviews.text: The look and feel of this watch was exactly what I was looking for so when I received one for a Christmas present I was very happy. It did not seem to record the steps correctly but I could live with that. The problems started when it stopped running after 6 weeks. I returned it to Amazon and they promptly replaced it with a new one. It lasted exactly three days before the crystal broke. I work in an office sitting at a desk all day and one minute the watch was fine and the next time I looked at it the crystal was cracked. I think Withings has a great concept but the quality is not there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Steps to getting healthy.
customer_reviews.text: Others are not able to tell that you are wearing an activity tracker. The watch communicates with my smart phone via bluetooth. It will track your sleep pattern and step counter but I am not sure how accurate it is. At the beginning, the band cut into my wrist when I was wearing it at night. After several days of not wearing it at night, I have not had any problem with it since
customer_reviews.author: ks

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof and awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I have worn many different fitness trackers and I love the Withings Activite Pop for it's accuracy, style and interactive app that tracks my sleep and helps me remember to weigh, take my heart rate & BP. I had their non-waterproof tracker but washed it a few times. This one doesn't come off and it really is great.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: it was fine, but for the price I would not buy
customer_reviews.text: Just past 6 months, the clock stopped working, it will no longer accept to connect to any device via Bluetooth, although I tried to change the battery, it was unsuccessful, simply does not pair anymore. It is a pity, while it worked, it was fine, but for the price I would not buy, only for a 6 months use, very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Miguel M Malpartida

customer_reviews.title: Love this watch/tracker/sleep gauge!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best tracker for the money. I love this watch and tracker. I get so many complements on it. I wanted an analog watch that was stylish, tracked exercise, and sleep. This is all that rolled up into one. I would like for the hands to glow in the dark but that is my only suggestion. I'll be buying more of these watches!
customer_reviews.author: escape hatch

customer_reviews.title: Problems.  Should be better for price
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how many stars to give as received watch on March 17 and on May 2 received a "low battery " notice. Since the company states battery should last much longer I am disappointed. I will be reaching out and calling Withings to find out the problem. Other than that watch works as indicated, but watch band gets smelly within a few weeks. If these problems were solved I would really enjoy the watch.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: I love everything about this
customer_reviews.text: 4 starts only because the original wrist band is causing a mild allergic reaction and I am NOT allergic to anything. But I ordered a different wrist band and am wearing the original one in the meantime. Other than that, I love everything about this watch: the looks, the functionality and the user-friendliness of the app!
customer_reviews.author: Sara G

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Watch
customer_reviews.text: I love my Withings Smart Watch. I really like that it just looks like a normal watch so it still looks professional to wear to work. I have a small wrist and a lot of times watches and bracelets are too big. This watch has enough holes on the band that I'm able to adjust it small enough. I had a problem with the glass on mine and within an hour Withings had resolved my issue - their customer service is phenomenal!
customer_reviews.author: MiHu

customer_reviews.title: Happy with product
customer_reviews.text: Perfect and doesn't look like a fitness tracker at all. (Which is what I wanted in the first place). The only complaint I would have is that the sleep tracking is a bit off. It doesn't register me as awake unless I actually get out of bed during the night. But, other than that it's great. The app is straightforward and easy to use as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Key Flaws in this product make FitBit or Garmin Vivomove much better options
customer_reviews.text: The benefit of this product is that it looks ok as a watch. However, the sleep tracking is not editable in the App like it is with Garmin or Fitbit, nor is the activity tracking. This wouldn't be a problem, except the activity tracker is often wrong, and the sleep tracker is so bad that it is basically unusable (it accurately documents my sleep less than 30% of the time). I'm giving up on Withings and switching to either the Fitbit Blaze or the Garmin Vivomove.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B Evans

customer_reviews.title: Tracks steps and sleep surprisingly well. Sleep tracking on ...
customer_reviews.text: Tracks steps and sleep surprisingly well. Sleep tracking on par with the sleep cycle app. But, -1 star for having to reset the time every week - the hands drift. -1 star for the hard plastic band which cut my skin, hand to replace it. And -1 for the silent alarm, which worked for a few weeks and then quit.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and effective at inspiring me to walk more
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those products that makes you wonder how you went so long without it. The watch is very stylish and totally acceptable to be paired with a business suit. I love the color and the sleek display of your daily activity. Nobody would know that it is an activity tracker unless I told them and it totally has the desired effect of making me take the stairs more/walk more around the neighborhood. I love that I don't need to pair it to anything to know my progress.
customer_reviews.author: MCC_DC

customer_reviews.title: Could not get it to work reliably with my phone
customer_reviews.text: The watch looks nice, it's not a little bit small for my wrist. Unfortunately it never sank correctly with my phone and could not get it to work . A shame because I like the look.
customer_reviews.author: RADAI CINTRON

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Watch/Activity Tracker
customer_reviews.text: I really like this activity tracker/watch. I was using a Fitbit, but purchased this because I like the look of a watch vs. a sports band. It's more versatile and simply looks like a watch so I can wear it with dressier clothing. It does everything I need it to do - steps, swimming, and sleep tracking. I'm very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: PattyB

customer_reviews.title: Great looking! Comfortable :) Easy to use - excellent activity and sleep tracking.
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with many things! The sleep accuracy is wonderful. I also really like the apps I can use with the watch. It's just what I wanted - attractive, water resistant, carefree (no charging!). Super comfortable and good looking! There isn't a heart rate monitor, but I'm not interested. The tracking is superlative, and I really like the ease, details, and flexibility of one of the online fitness apps that work it, myfitnessmap.com
customer_reviews.author: Beth Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Watch worked well for 6 months and then it experienced multiple issues. The watch stopped keeping accurate time, the alarm stopped working reliably, and the actual step tracking didn't seem to be accurate. Basically all of the key features became obsolete making the watch useless. Very disappointed with the watch as it was a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Aric van Iterson

customer_reviews.title: Great looking watch that happens to be an excellent fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: Best looking fitness tracker out there, in my opinion. I've had many others (Garmin, FitBit x2) that had more "features" but I found notifications soon became annoying and I like the more analog look. I often get compliments on this watch and people are surprised when I tell them what else it can do. The iOS (and probably Android) app is updated fairly often and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T. Wingrove

customer_reviews.title: I love the look and feel of a traditional watch
customer_reviews.text: I love the look and feel of a traditional watch, but stopped wearing one since joining the fitbit craze. I found wearing a fitbit and watch on the same wrist was to much. This gives me the best of both items and I like the Withings app better than fitbits.
customer_reviews.author: shoppingtripp

customer_reviews.title: I love thiswatch
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch! I bought the small because I have very thin wrists and it fits! No having to hammer in additional holes in the watch band. The pedometer works great especially with the app on my phone. I also like the pink color. Looks cute with any outfit.
customer_reviews.author: Windy City ReaderTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: It works great. I love it
customer_reviews.text: It works great. I love it. It counts my sleep time and walking. I used FitBit previously, but it was a pedometer with clock. This device is clocked with really nice pedometer and great app for synchronization. Vibration alarm could wake me up gently, but it isn't smart. It does not tune wake up time with my sleep phases. So pity!
customer_reviews.author: Mikhail Kiselev

customer_reviews.title: I needed it for the Step count that beautifully displays on the watch
customer_reviews.text: First Impression: The dial could have been a touch bigger!!!!!!!!! Getting started with this watch was no fuss at all. install the app the watch syncs in and you are all set. Don't compare it with apple watch to have all the dial personalization. It is what it is and for the price it gives you all. I needed it for the Step count that beautifully displays on the watch. rest of the stuff is just another app on the app store. Happy with what i got. Will update the review of how long the battery lasts later.
customer_reviews.author: Maverick

customer_reviews.title: I like the watch feature
customer_reviews.text: I haven't taken this off since I bought it several months ago. I like the watch feature, and the fact that it syncs to my phone. I wish it counted elevation, because when I go up 1,100 feet in the span of a mile, I would like a little more recognition. Or when I've hiked up the stairs at work again and again. It also has a hard time telling when I'm reading in my bed and sleeping. But overall, Withings has a pretty decent product.
customer_reviews.author: Shelli Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: It's a really good fitness tracker but beware if you buy it in ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a really good fitness tracker but beware if you buy it in the Sand color. I've had mine for about a month and the wristband is already starting to look a little grimy. I'm disappointed that I can't purchase a replacement band in the same color and that if I want to buy more bands I have to buy 3 in odd colors--I don't have the option to replace just the one. Super annoying. If had gotten it in grey instead of sand, this would be a 5 star review--I really love the tracker itself!
customer_reviews.author: Gail Eisenberg

customer_reviews.title: Can't be read in the dark
customer_reviews.text: It does not have any luminesence on the hands so its unreadable in the dark. Every thing else works as advertised
customer_reviews.author: Dennis P

customer_reviews.title: i wear it all the time even in the shower. That way the band gets wash when I do and everything stays fresh..
customer_reviews.text: I have been enjoying everything about this watch . It tracks sleep and activity well. The program that it comes with to link with your smart phone allows me to take and record and keep track of my heart rate. I have had it about a month or so now and I just got my 400 mile badge. It gives you accomplishment badges along the way. I highly recommend this to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Blue.Sky's

customer_reviews.title: Good activity tracker for those who don't want a watch that looks like an activity tracker
customer_reviews.text: This watch is marketed as a “smart watch,” however there are not many smart features about it. It basically just tracks your steps and that’s it. The watch has a very nice aesthetic and looks like a normal watch when first looking at it. The watch did not contain enough fitness tracking features for me so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: J-SPEEDY

customer_reviews.title: The perfect smartwatch
customer_reviews.text: I love my withings and even though I've run into some small issues (my screen popped and I've had issues with replacing the battery) their customer service has always handled the matter well. I adore the simplicity and step tracking on the watch. The app will allow you and friends to compete for steps and I love seeing how much sleep I get... or don't get. I do not need another device telling me how many people are reaching out to me. This keeps it simple. Love my withings.
customer_reviews.author: Marnie R.

product_meta.title: Withings Activité Pop - Activity & Sleep-Tracking Watch
product_meta.description:
The Withings Activite Pop is a radiant watch combining time and activity tracking. Activite Pop tracks your activity level and keeps you in the know with a clear analog feedback. Activite Pop automatically syncs with your smartphone using Bluetooth Low Energy, allowing you to see your progress and to receive real-time coaching in the free Health Mate app.

BOX CONTAINS
1 x Activity Tracker Watch
feature_bullets: Track steps, running, calories burned and distance
Analyse your swim workouts, water-resistant 50 meters/ 5 ATM
Sleep analysis and silent vibrating alarm
Automatic synchronization to track all your progress on your smartphone
Track steps, running, calories burned and distance
Analyse your swim workouts, water-resistant 50 meters/ 5 ATM
Sleep analysis and silent vibrating alarm Up to 8-month battery life
Automatic synchronization to track all your progress on your smartphone
The Withings Activate Pop is a radiant watch combining time and activity tracking. Activate Pop tracks your activity level and keeps you in the know with a clear analog feedback.

specifications.Style: Activity and Sleep Tracker Smart Watch
specifications.Compatible with: IOS 7.0 ou version ultérieure, Android 4.3 ou version ultérieure
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars1,321 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
